title: Barcelona vs Inter Milan prediction: How will Champions League clash play out?
text:
Barcelona host Inter Milan at the Nou Camp to bring back memories of their famous tie from 2010.

Jose Mourinho’s Nerazzurri pulled off the unthinkable and denied the Blaugrana a mini dynasty of three successive Champions League titles.

The compelling second leg saw Gerard Pique set up a thrilling finish, with 10-man Inter surviving after Thiago Motta’s red card following Sergio Busquets’ theatrics.

We’ll tell you what’s true. You can form your own view. From 15p €0.18 $0.18 USD 0.27 a day, more exclusives, analysis and extras.

Now with Antonio Conte in charge and building a new side, Inter’s start to their European campaign was disastrous, having failed to win at home to Slavia Prague.

With Borussia Dortmund their other rivals in Group F, Inter will be desperate to take something from their games against the Spanish giants. Here is everything you need to know:

Prediction

With the fitness of Lionel Messi in doubt, Barcelona will be far short of their mercurial best and Conte’s side will be vigorous in their defence. But, while the Italian’s back-five may be hard to break down, the individual quality of the home side should eventually shine though, despite a wavering start to this season.

Barcelona 2-0 Inter Milan

Team News

Lionel Messi is expected to miss out with an adductor problem, however, the Argentinian may be able to make the bench. Ousmane Dembele is also returning from injury and has only recently returned to training meaning he is unlikely to feature.

Inter boast an injury-free squad with Alexis Sanchez expected to make the starting line-up after scoring twice before being sent off against Sampdoria last week.

Predicted Line-ups:

Barcelona: Ter Stegen; Semedo, Pique, Lenglet, Firpo; Busquets, Arthur, De Jong; Griezmann, Perez, Suarez.

Inter: Handanovic; D’Ambrosio, Godin, De Vrij, Skriniar, Asamoah, Sensi, Brozovic, Barella; Sanchez, Lukaku.

When is it?

Kick-off at the Camp Nou is at 8pm (BST) on Wednesday 2 October.

How can I watch it?

The match will be broadcast live on BT Sport ESPN and can be streamed live online via the BT app and website.

Odds

Barcelona 1/2

Draw 10/3

Inter 5/1
